intro: Dicoelia beccariana, commonly known as the Beccarian's dicoelia, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has a short, woody stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to habitat loss, it is considered an endangered species and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
